revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-18 16:26:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue moving hosts back to freepool

If an aggregate fails to be created for some reason, for example because
the requested node is not in the freepool, some cleanup occurs. Part of
the cleanup is ensuring the target node is moved _back_ to the freepool.
This should theoretically "heal" cases where the node wasn't in the
freepool but also wasn't in some lease aggregate.

However, this call to Nova's API refers to the freepool aggregate by its
name, which is not supported here: the ID must be used[1]. This caused
this operation to fail and raise a NotFound, confusingly (because Nova
couldn't find an aggregate with ID='freepool' for example.)

[1]:
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=add-host-detail#add-host

Closes-Bug: #1847821
Change-Id: I7af4d407b183578617131f0de42becb3dc2bc415
(cherry picked from commit 0346b02ccea75b992d0b72a6dbaa1f05864450e0)

commit_message:
Fix issue moving hosts back to freepool

If an aggregate fails to be created for some reason, for example because
the requested node is not in the freepool, some cleanup occurs. Part of
the cleanup is ensuring the target node is moved _back_ to the freepool.
This should theoretically "heal" cases where the node wasn't in the
freepool but also wasn't in some lease aggregate.

However, this call to Nova's API refers to the freepool aggregate by its
name, which is not supported here: the ID must be used[1]. This caused
this operation to fail and raise a NotFound, confusingly (because Nova
couldn't find an aggregate with ID='freepool' for example.)

[1]:
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=add-host-detail#add-host

Closes-Bug: #1847821
Change-Id: I7af4d407b183578617131f0de42becb3dc2bc415
(cherry picked from commit 0346b02ccea75b992d0b72a6dbaa1f05864450e0)
(cherry picked from commit b30cece36ea143a97544799fb807644a51fd1c60)

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt to fix unit tests

The unit tests fail since no mysqladmin command is installed. Add
bindep.txt to install the needed binaries in our CI environment.

Add also the usual bindep tox environment for developers.

Change-Id: If951f82d6610c6ee54d594d9a8985bc78e135d2b
(cherry picked from commit 64a1d26aaf0368af4ea4773b41520a0802786fb3)

- The 'wheel' group is renamed to 'bdist_wheel' [2]
- Update the urls to latest

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 12:40:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add test for the race between post live migration and update available resource

The ResourceTracker._populate_assigned_resources populates the resources from
instance.migration_context. But if there is post live migration executed before
that, the migration_context of instance is dropped. That trigger the bug
NoneType error when access migration.instance.migration_context.

Change-Id: Id8cb234eae49699bf6ed13611a0d91c0358347f3
Related-Bugs: #1849165
'}]
commit_message:
Add test for the race between post live migration and update available resource

The ResourceTracker._populate_assigned_resources populates the resources from
instance.migration_context. But if there is post live migration executed before
that, the migration_context of instance is dropped. That trigger the bug
NoneType error when access migration.instance.migration_context.

Change-Id: Id8cb234eae49699bf6ed13611a0d91c0358347f3
Related-Bugs: #1849165

[{'created': '2019-10-12 08:20:58.000000000', 'message': "Add policy config for get_flavor_service_profile operation

Policy for this API call was commented out but it is needed
for DELETE flavor_service_profile operation as Neutron's policy
module looks for ability for SHOW command when DELETE is rejected
to ensure what error message should be returned to the user.

This patch will fix Patrole test failure, see related bug description
for details.

Change-Id: I4a0e97845a40888f7f2c7267d9adb7be663ee380
Closes-Bug: #1843290
(cherry picked from commit ac0a426017e92d5d73e97c26ef18a888e02da104)
"}]
commit_message:
Add policy config for get_flavor_service_profile operation

Policy for this API call was commented out but it is needed
for DELETE flavor_service_profile operation as Neutron's policy
module looks for ability for SHOW command when DELETE is rejected
to ensure what error message should be returned to the user.

This patch will fix Patrole test failure, see related bug description
for details.

Change-Id: I4a0e97845a40888f7f2c7267d9adb7be663ee380
Closes-Bug: #1843290
(cherry picked from commit ac0a426017e92d5d73e97c26ef18a888e02da104)

[{'created': '2019-10-03 13:17:29.000000000', 'message': 'Move agent listing from resource_stup to setUp

To avoid issues with updated agents move the listing of the agents from
test class level to setUp method which is executed before every test
method. This will not solve 100% the issue, as tests are running
parallely.

Change-Id: I7af97ac0ee396d2eb132459d29e938bd5f3de9aa
Related-Bug: #1845330
'}, {'created': '2019-10-04 09:02:56.000000000', 'message': 'Move agent listing from resource_setup to setUp

To avoid issues with updated agents move the listing of the agents from
test class level to setUp method which is executed before every test
method. This will not solve 100% the issue, as tests are running
parallely.

Change-Id: I7af97ac0ee396d2eb132459d29e938bd5f3de9aa
Related-Bug: #1845330
'}, {'created': '2019-10-04 14:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'Make one agent untouchable in test_agent_management

In test_agent_management some tests depend on one agent to be unmodified
which was not guaranteed as some tests updated that agent.
The update happened because the update test assumed that neutron will
return list of agents in different order.
The fix is only to select always different agent for update than the one
used for other tests.

Change-Id: I7af97ac0ee396d2eb132459d29e938bd5f3de9aa
Closes-Bug: #1845330
'}]
commit_message:
Make one agent untouchable in test_agent_management

In test_agent_management some tests depend on one agent to be unmodified
which was not guaranteed as some tests updated that agent.
The update happened because the update test assumed that neutron will
return list of agents in different order.
The fix is only to select always different agent for update than the one
used for other tests.

Change-Id: I7af97ac0ee396d2eb132459d29e938bd5f3de9aa
Closes-Bug: #1845330

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 11:32:42.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'senlin-tempest-api-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'senlin-tempest-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'senlin-tempest-api-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35929

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ib7695212e42ef16dbc1edd65c3516b277e99078d

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'senlin-tempest-api-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'senlin-tempest-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'senlin-tempest-api-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35929

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ib7695212e42ef16dbc1edd65c3516b277e99078d

commit_message:
raise priority of dead vlan drop

- This change adds a max priority flow to drop
  all traffic that is associated with the
  DEAD VLAN 4095.
- This change is part of a partial mitigation of
  bug 1734320. Without this change vlan 4095 traffic
  will be dropped via a low priority flow after being
  processed by part/all of the openflow pipeline.
  By raising the priorty and droping in table 0
  we drop invalid packets as soon as they enter
  the pipeline.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/test_br_int.py

Change-Id: I3482c7c4f00942828cc9396cd2f3d646c9e8c9d1
Partial-Bug: #1734320
(cherry picked from commit e3dc447b908f57e9acc0378111b8e09cbd88ddc5)

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I17f3a223ff46b1300d6eba0cd990b1daa730a4c9

commit_message:
Add retry and debug logs to NoAuthClient of placement client

Based on logstash (see [0])
test_configurations_are_synced_towards_placement sporadically fails.
Based on the logs it seems that when the dummy placement wsgi server
restarts the client can't connect to it, to make the situation cleaner
I added some logs for the different possible requests exceptions and a
simple retry mechanism.

[0]: http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22test_agent_bandwidth_report.py*%20line%20249%2C%20in%20test_configurations_are_synced_towards_placement%5C%22

Change-Id: I283c4b159ad0b9ffef8a6f5a3bfe1fe2feac8210

commit_message:
Remove check for content-length on delete

There is no garuantee that content-length is set when
the payload is empty. It is also not a required field for
HTTP Status 204 (No Content) or DELETE.

Change-Id: Ifdd7cdef3a214a1153563c12e349dda9f179a2ad

commit_message:
Polish 1910 release notes - part I

This doesn't add anything qualitatively different. It
adds polish in terms of formatting, slight word changes,
fixes broken links, and moves the order of a paragraph.

The Upgrading OpenStack section re placement was changed
to sync to what is in app-upgrade-openstack.rst (CDG).

Removed text on Ceph was transferred to
app-upgrade-openstack.rst.

commit_message:
Remove plugin projects from test-requirements.txt

Plugin projects were listed in test-requirements.txt ostensibly to pull
them in for autodoc building. However, test-requirements.txt wasn't
being used for that purpose -- doc/requirements.txt was, so [1] added
them there. So this commit removes them from test-requirements.txt where
they're unused.

[1] Id9be39971110fd2eb4519a0582c9bf2514cdcacd

Change-Id: Ia89888ee05e17da636ee46894232624e0178d6bc

commit_message:
Add plugin doc page for watcher

This was being omitted because whenever the plugin page was produced,
python-watcherclient wasn't in global-requirements. It is now, so
include a page for it in the plugin docs.

NOTE: We would like to use autoprogram-cliff to make the documentation
complete, but that breaks the build. For now, this is better than
nothing.

Change-Id: I49822242b9a0c031a053d6c2fd9f644a585f4ba5

commit_message:
Link to (some) plugin doc pages

We would like to use autoprogram-cliff to generate full docs inline for
each plugin. But for the following projects, that breaks the build:

- octavia
- rsd
- trove
- watcher
- zun

For those projects, we're using list-plugins instead, because that
builds, and it's better than nothing; but it only provides summaries of
the commands.

So with this commit, we add a link to the plugin documentation from the
actual plugin project where such documentation exists, which currently
is just:

- octavia
- watcher
- zun

(For rsd, I couldn't find openstack-published docs at all; for trove,
published docs exist, but the osc plugin isn't documented.)

Change-Id: I7c826ecef4319bead239e11b5f975302b2f24d1b
Story: #1735016
Task: #37244

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-13 02:32:12.000000000', 'message': "Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over
cells and listing instances using a marker. Once we find the marker, be that
in build_requests, or one of the cells, we need to set the marker to None to
stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Change-Id: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab
Closes-Bug: #1737856
"}]
commit_message:
Raise MarkerNotFound if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters doesn't find marker

For some reason, probably because build requests are meant to be short lived
and we don't get a lot of bugs about paging misbehavior, when paging instances
with a marker, we didn't raise MarkerNotFound if we didn't find the marker in
the list of build requests. Doing so would match what we do when paging over
cells and listing instances using a marker. Once we find the marker, be that
in build_requests, or one of the cells, we need to set the marker to None to
stop looking for it elsewhere if we have more space to fill our limit.

For example, see change I8a957bebfcecd6ac712103c346e028d80f1ecd7c.

This patch fixes the issue by raising MarkerNotFound from BuildRequestList
get_by_filters if there is a marker and we didn't find a build request for
it. The compute API get_all() method handles that as normal and continues
looking for the marker in one of the cells.

Change-Id: I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab
Closes-Bug: #1737856

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9795bf48359e9283b19fd30bb0c87e56e0760211

commit_message:
Produce complete content for plugin docs

Plugin documentation previously used ``.. list-plugins::`` for each
plugin command, which just produced the summary line. This might be
useful if there were also a link to the complete (per-project) docs for
the commands; but since we have the content available, we might as well
produce the complete plugin docs inline. That's going to be most useful
to a reader anyway.

So this commit switches from ``list-plugins`` to ``autoprogram-cliff``
-- except for the following, whose docs break the build when this is
done:

- octavia
- rsd
- trove
- zun

These fixups are tracked under task #37241 under this same story.

Change-Id: I2f17e203fe3da92a709884c9052c8e39ff87f4c8
Story: #1735016
Task: #37240

commit_message:
Fix osc-lib interface change: catch osc-lib Forbidden

The patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673389/
introduced a regression by changing the osc-lib
interface.

The patch
https://review.opendev.org/683119
changes the exception from the generic CommandError
back to a specific Forbidden exception.

This patch catches this exception and passes on, i.e.
re-implements the same behavior as before.

Story: 2006547

Change-Id: I17b1ec7abaa5b0828ccbcad40bd928565c5c59fb
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

subject: Fix compute service set handling for 2.53+
messages: [{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-09-25 10:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-09-25 10:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to story/2005349'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-09-26 05:45:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-10-22 19:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-25 10:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix compute service set handling for 2.53+

With compute API microversion 2.53 there is a single
PUT /os-services/{service_id} API which takes the service
id as a UUID. Since the openstack compute service set
command only takes --host and --service (binary) to identify
the service, this change checks if 2.53 or greater is being
used and if so, looks up the service by host and binary and
calls the appropriate methods in novaclient.

If the command cannot uniquely identify a compute service
with the given host and binary, an error is raised. A future
change could add an --id option to be used with 2.53+ to
pass the service id (as UUID) directly to avoid the host/binary
filtering.

Conflicts:
    openstackclient/compute/v2/service.py
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to missing patch on stable/queens:
I0a87e02e71ff025d30181fc17ebcd003a590f110

Change-Id: I868e0868e8eb17e7e34eef3d2d58dceedd29c2b0
Story: 2005349
Task: 30302
(cherry picked from commit 4bd53dc1090fda86f6ce25b76a079e250c9206d8)
(cherry picked from commit 100d34c54ecdfedf6fb40a2686e1aae1f54df97e)
(cherry picked from commit fc5f2978c0f4f1e3360325b00c1f1b99f1e6318f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix compute service set handling for 2.53+

With compute API microversion 2.53 there is a single
PUT /os-services/{service_id} API which takes the service
id as a UUID. Since the openstack compute service set
command only takes --host and --service (binary) to identify
the service, this change checks if 2.53 or greater is being
used and if so, looks up the service by host and binary and
calls the appropriate methods in novaclient.

If the command cannot uniquely identify a compute service
with the given host and binary, an error is raised. A future
change could add an --id option to be used with 2.53+ to
pass the service id (as UUID) directly to avoid the host/binary
filtering.

Conflicts:
    openstackclient/compute/v2/service.py
Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to missing patch on stable/queens:
I0a87e02e71ff025d30181fc17ebcd003a590f110

Change-Id: I868e0868e8eb17e7e34eef3d2d58dceedd29c2b0
Story: 2005349
Task: 30302
(cherry picked from commit 4bd53dc1090fda86f6ce25b76a079e250c9206d8)
(cherry picked from commit 100d34c54ecdfedf6fb40a2686e1aae1f54df97e)
(cherry picked from commit fc5f2978c0f4f1e3360325b00c1f1b99f1e6318f)

commit_message:
Split plugin docs per project

Once [1] fixed plugin doc generation, the (single) page it produced was
unusably huge. This commit splits it into one page per project.

Note that there are four plugin projects that didn't have sections
included:

- cue
- murano
- tripleo
- watcher

These were noted in hidden rst which is preserved in the (new) index
page.

[1] Id9be39971110fd2eb4519a0582c9bf2514cdcacd

Change-Id: I0214ddb00a5a292a46d7cfb539d6dcc540fdae79
Story: #1735016
Task: #37239

subject: Fix plugin autodoc generation
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-21 21:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-21 21:35:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Rendered: https://8728c3420492afd1b41a-06fd4184f2cef7745958cc2583c9060a.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/689876/1/check/openstack-tox-docs/9b229f2/docs/cli/plugin-commands.html

This is an improvement in that cli/plugin-commands.html now has actual content. But we're far from done; that content is non-pretty. Things that stand out at a glance:
- There's now a bullet list at the top of the page (generated by ``.. list-plugins:: openstack.cli.extension``) which seems to overlap with the list of plugins on the page; but in a different order (since it seems to be sorted by API_NAME rather than project name) and with some weirdnesses (like: 'metric' shows up twice; and several plugins don't have descriptions -- guessing these would be remedied within the plugin projects themselves).
- The page is huge. We should consider splitting it into its constituent projects and make this page just a TOC.
- Only the command summaries are shown. This might be okay if there was also a link to the plugin's own docs; but why not just include the whole doc here, since we have it on hand?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-21 21:40:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix plugin autodoc generation

Documentation for plugins wasn't being generated because the plugin
projects weren't being installed in the docs environment. Add them to
doc/requirements.txt to make this work.

Change-Id: Id9be39971110fd2eb4519a0582c9bf2514cdcacd
Story: #1735016
Task: #13825

commit_message:
Add parent project filter for listing projects

This patch introduces a new option --parent into project list,
to specify a parent project to filter projects which has
the given project as their parent.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677101
Change-Id: I6725262cf040e0ec6ceca9cf0462ce59224049c6

commit_message:
Fix: Restore output 'VolumeBackupsRestore' object is not iterable

VolumeBackupsRetore object has '_info' attribute
which contains the output data of the restore
command which should be returned instead of the
'VolumeBackupsRestore' object.

Change-Id: I64b75649c1ac9c24e05a197f7280975564b4d386
Story: 2004740
Task: 28811
(cherry picked from commit 24255ad0dde608a19d371a27c13714098097f185)
(cherry picked from commit 7882463fda77813c9e230373f0ab53c6c8574ba3)

subject: Document 2.53 behavior for compute service list/delete
messages: [{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-09-25 16:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-09-25 16:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to story/2005349'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-10-22 19:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-25 16:24:15.000000000', 'message': 'Document 2.53 behavior for compute service list/delete

With compute API microversion 2.53, nova-compute services
can only be deleted with the ID as a UUID to uniquely identify
the service in a multi-cell deployment. This documents that for
the "compute service delete <service>" argument. The description
of the "compute service list" command is also updated to mention
that the ID can be retrieved as a UUID using 2.53 or greater.

Change-Id: If7d4a27c0aaef588bcd77dd9edddec1e535fbf31
Story: 2005349
Task: 30302
(cherry picked from commit 1557afb554e908e097abd39081891ea78083e20e)
(cherry picked from commit 111d6a9b23d8c6b9bcce437039ff49536f0b5dd1)
(cherry picked from commit 72922ae1a1b842b1a5058377f8033cbf09086b4c)
'}]
commit_message:
Document 2.53 behavior for compute service list/delete

With compute API microversion 2.53, nova-compute services
can only be deleted with the ID as a UUID to uniquely identify
the service in a multi-cell deployment. This documents that for
the "compute service delete <service>" argument. The description
of the "compute service list" command is also updated to mention
that the ID can be retrieved as a UUID using 2.53 or greater.

Change-Id: If7d4a27c0aaef588bcd77dd9edddec1e535fbf31
Story: 2005349
Task: 30302
(cherry picked from commit 1557afb554e908e097abd39081891ea78083e20e)
(cherry picked from commit 111d6a9b23d8c6b9bcce437039ff49536f0b5dd1)
(cherry picked from commit 72922ae1a1b842b1a5058377f8033cbf09086b4c)

commit_message:
ussuri: release sqlalchemy-migrate 0.13.0

This release most just contains cleanups and officially
adds support for python 3.5 and 3.6. It uses mysqlclient
rather than the old MySQL-Python.

Note this is the first release since the repo moved from
the openstack to x namespace in opendev.

Change-Id: I517880906019ea52f9b3731319abcad55f92915d

[{'created': '2019-10-22 08:22:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix api version not providing the full url

We are currently using host_url to build the version
href which causes the /dns portion to get dropped. This
patch changes host_url to url_root and enables
enable_host_header by default.

We also deprecate api_base_uri as this is no
longer recommended.

Change-Id: Ie8d815391b316d664b0c51099a08d8d32932c555
'}, {'created': '2019-10-22 08:40:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix api version not providing the full url

We are currently using host_url to build the version
href which causes the /dns portion to get dropped. This
patch changes host_url to url_root.

We also deprecate api_base_uri and enable_host_header.

Finally we add a help url that points at the
designate api reference.

Change-Id: Ie8d815391b316d664b0c51099a08d8d32932c555
'}, {'created': '2019-10-22 08:44:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix api version not providing the full url

We are currently using host_url to build the version
href which causes the /dns portion to get dropped. This
patch changes host_url to url_root. We also enable
enable_host_header by default.

Finally we add a help url that points at the
designate api reference.

Change-Id: Ie8d815391b316d664b0c51099a08d8d32932c555
'}]
commit_message:
Fix api version not providing the full url

We are currently using host_url to build the version
href which causes the /dns portion to get dropped. This
patch changes host_url to url_root. We also enable
enable_host_header by default.

Finally we add a help url that points at the
designate api reference.

Change-Id: Ie8d815391b316d664b0c51099a08d8d32932c555

commit_message:
Health probe for Ranger-services pod

Health probe for Ranger-services pod is used for both liveness
and readiness probe.

Health probe launches a call to ranger services open interfaces.
Probe is successful if call returns without error; otherwise failure
will be reported.

Change-Id: I55ce381f344330157085ef294a169ea6df975737

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-05-31 09:35:53.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that periodic reclaim is able to clean DB deleted instances

Under some circumstances, the _reclaim_queued_deletes tries to delete
some instances that are partially deleted in the DB, failing with an
InstanceNotFound error. The error persists until an operator manually
removes the instance causing the exception. This change ensures that the
_reclaim_queued_deletes method is getting the deleted instances as well
so that the cleanup can be completed.

Change-Id: Ia8a0d07bfca04cb86b5f17678ecc99222753e239
Closes-Bug: #1587356

commit_message:
Ensure that periodic reclaim cleans DB deleted instances

Under some circumstances, the _reclaim_queued_deletes tries to delete
some instances that are partially deleted in the DB, failing with an
InstanceNotFound error. The error persists until an operator manually
removes the instance causing the exception. This change ensures that the
_reclaim_queued_deletes method is getting the deleted instances as well
so that the cleanup can be completed.

Closes-Bug: #1587356
Change-Id: Ia8a0d07bfca04cb86b5f17678ecc99222753e239

(2 comments)

Overall, I think the existing app-upgrade-openstack.rst doc does not adequately disambiguate the difference between a Charm upgrade and an OpenStack upgrade.

I think that the proposed changes actually further the ambiguation between the two distinct types of upgrades (Charm upgrade vs. OpenStack upgrade).

I would recommend splitting this into 2 reviews at minimum:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-12 17:08:34.000000000', 'message': 'Make system tokens work with domain-specific drivers

When calling certain group or user APIs, keystone logic would attempt
to figure out the domain to scope responses to. This was specific to
enabling domain-specific driver support, where each domain is backed
by a different identity store. This functionality is turned off by
default. Since system-scoped tokens are not assocaited to a domain
(unlike project-scoped tokens or domain-scoped tokens), the logic to
determine a domain from a system-scoped token was breaking and
returning an erroneous HTTP 401 Unauthorized when system users
attempted to list uesrs or groups.

This commit adds support for domain detection with system-scoped
tokens.

Change-Id: I8f0f7a623a1741f461493d872849fae7ef3e8077
Closes-Bug: 1843609
(cherry picked from commit b152d7e52caa817de0c42ed356dada07c7d0d370)

commit_message:
Make system tokens work with domain-specific drivers

When calling certain group or user APIs, keystone logic would attempt
to figure out the domain to scope responses to. This was specific to
enabling domain-specific driver support, where each domain is backed
by a different identity store. This functionality is turned off by
default. Since system-scoped tokens are not associated to a domain
(unlike project-scoped tokens or domain-scoped tokens), the logic to
determine a domain from a system-scoped token was breaking and
returning an erroneous HTTP 401 Unauthorized when system users
attempted to list users or groups.

This commit adds support for domain detection with system-scoped
tokens.

Change-Id: I8f0f7a623a1741f461493d872849fae7ef3e8077
Closes-Bug: 1843609
(cherry picked from commit 8f43b9cab00c86a455b2a9700b434e98b2e9c2d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 20:16:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix etcd healthcheck

The etcd healthcheck was not working as it was trying to use
127.0.0.1:2379 as the etcd endpoint when none was specified.

This patch updates the healthcheck to set the $ETCDCTL_ENDPOINTS
environment variable for the etcdctl command after reading the value
from /etc/etcd/etcd.conf.

Change-Id: If5ee2fdecf8c9ba458bce92fc2c427aeed1b865a
'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 14:22:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix etcd healthcheck

The etcd healthcheck was not working as it was trying to use
127.0.0.1:2379 as the etcd endpoint when none was specified.

This patch updates the healthcheck to set the $ETCDCTL_ENDPOINTS
environment variable for the etcdctl command after reading the value
from /etc/etcd/etcd.conf.

It also updates the existing healthcheck logic to use "grep -q" so that
log entries are not continually created every time the healthcheck is
executed.

Change-Id: If5ee2fdecf8c9ba458bce92fc2c427aeed1b865a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix etcd healthcheck

The etcd healthcheck was not working as it was trying to use
127.0.0.1:2379 as the etcd endpoint when none was specified.

This patch updates the healthcheck to set the $ETCDCTL_ENDPOINTS
environment variable for the etcdctl command after reading the value
from /etc/etcd/etcd.conf.

It also updates the existing healthcheck logic to use "grep -q" so that
log entries are not continually created every time the healthcheck is
executed.

Change-Id: If5ee2fdecf8c9ba458bce92fc2c427aeed1b865a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 11:07:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix service_name in process_certificates call

Fix service_name when calling process_certificates so it matches
what ApacheSSLContext expects.

Ceilometers Apache config is rendered using
ceilometer_contexts.ApacheSSLContext. This class is a subclass of
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.context.ApacheSSLContext. The
ceilometer specialised class sets 'service_namespace = "ceilometer"'.
This is then used by parent class to set the destination for certs
and keys to:

ssl_dir = os.path.join('/etc/apache2/ssl/', self.service_namespace)

The code to process incoming certificates from the certificates
relation does something very similar.
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.cert_utils.process_certificates
takes a service_name parameter. It uses this to set the destination
directory that incoming certificates will be stored in:

ssl_dir = os.path.join('/etc/apache2/ssl/', service_name)

Obviously these two ssl directories need to match. But they do not
because process_certificates is currently called like this:

cert_utils.process_certificates('ceilometer-api', relation_id, unit)

Change-Id: I41a26d00b4d2b22a5cfd2ef38ec76f2efd13f75b
Closes-Bug: #1849292
'}]
commit_message:
Fix service_name in process_certificates call

Fix service_name when calling process_certificates so it matches
what ApacheSSLContext expects.

Ceilometers Apache config is rendered using
ceilometer_contexts.ApacheSSLContext. This class is a subclass of
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.context.ApacheSSLContext. The
ceilometer specialised class sets 'service_namespace = "ceilometer"'.
This is then used by parent class to set the destination for certs
and keys to:

ssl_dir = os.path.join('/etc/apache2/ssl/', self.service_namespace)

The code to process incoming certificates from the certificates
relation does something very similar.
charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.cert_utils.process_certificates
takes a service_name parameter. It uses this to set the destination
directory that incoming certificates will be stored in:

ssl_dir = os.path.join('/etc/apache2/ssl/', service_name)

Obviously these two ssl directories need to match. But they do not
because process_certificates is currently called like this:

cert_utils.process_certificates('ceilometer-api', relation_id, unit)

Change-Id: I41a26d00b4d2b22a5cfd2ef38ec76f2efd13f75b
Closes-Bug: #1849292

messages:
[{'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-10-18 14:55:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-10-18 15:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-10-21 09:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-21 10:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-21 10:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Looking at commit 51d71097c99ad9ad67fca1530be69101a70e411e (Add custom ethertype processing),
I am not sure which is better 12.1.1 or 12.2.0. It potentially affects existing users who depend on the current behavior of ovs firewall.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-21 15:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Looking at commit 51d71097c99ad9ad67fca1530be69101a70e411e (Add
 > custom ethertype processing),
 > I am not sure which is better 12.1.1 or 12.2.0. It potentially
 > affects existing users who depend on the current behavior of ovs
 > firewall.

This is a good point. Since the commit message explicitly points out that it is a behavior change, it probably would be safer to raise the minor version to make sure consumers are aware that they may get different behavior by upgrading to this release.'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-10-21 20:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Technically the change is between existing ovs and iptables firewall behaviours, that commit mostly adds the capacity to modify ovs firewall behaviour to be like iptables one.
But with default variable (if I remember and read code correctly), ovs firewall behaves as previous version.
That said, no strong objection about going to 12.2.0 :)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-21 20:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

If default behavior remains the same, then I think the bugfix version bump is appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-10-22 18:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-22 19:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-14 14:48:15.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: hyper-v: autospec classes before they are instantiated

Most of the classes used by the Hyper-V Driver also have
their initialisations, which can take time during unit tests
because of all the useless mocks that will be created for them.

This patch serves two purposes:

1. Autospec all of the classes that will be used by a module.
2. Mock the classes that will be used by a module before
they are initialised, in order to save time during unit tests.

Change-Id: Iedd1b8d0a5ffb9504f281d2a6f8d61d22eec8495
'}, {'created': '2016-07-14 16:55:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: hyper-v: autospec classes before they are instantiated

Most of the classes used by the Hyper-V Driver also have
their initialisations, which can take time during unit tests
because of all the useless mocks that will be created for them.

This patch serves two purposes:

1. Autospec all of the classes that will be used by a module.
2. Mock the classes that will be used by a module before
they are initialised, in order to save time during unit tests.

Change-Id: Iedd1b8d0a5ffb9504f281d2a6f8d61d22eec8495

'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 11:46:53.000000000', 'message': 'hyper-v: autospec classes before they are instantiated

The unit tests for the HyperVDriver and other classes used by it are
replacing different *ops and *utils attributes with mocks without
autospecing. This can easily lead to false positive tests, not catching
any wrong method calls.

Partial-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: Iedd1b8d0a5ffb9504f281d2a6f8d61d22eec8495

commit_message:
hyper-v: autospec classes before they are instantiated

The unit tests for the HyperVDriver and other classes used by it are
replacing different *ops and *utils attributes with mocks without
autospecing. This can easily lead to false positive tests, not catching
any wrong method calls.

Depends-On: Icd96beba5a32001cf33f075b801471c6e7c75898

Partial-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: Iedd1b8d0a5ffb9504f281d2a6f8d61d22eec8495

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-17 20:52:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix K2K auth flow diagram

The keystone-to-keystone auth flow diagram contained a minor error that
could lead to confusion. When a client POSTs a SAMLResponse to the PAOS
URL of the keystone Service Provider, the response is not automatically
a keystone token but an HTTP redirect that indicates the session is
successfully authenticated. The client then must ignore the Location
header of the redirect and instead start the token request process with
keystone's federated authentication endpoint. This change adds the extra
step to the diagram to help clarify the process.

Change-Id: I5c256388c2247eba4e559eb94cc9fb1bcd42444a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix K2K auth flow diagram

The keystone-to-keystone auth flow diagram contained a minor error that
could lead to confusion. When a client POSTs a SAMLResponse to the PAOS
URL of the keystone Service Provider, the response is not automatically
a keystone token but an HTTP redirect that indicates the session is
successfully authenticated. The client then must ignore the Location
header of the redirect and instead start the token request process with
keystone's federated authentication endpoint. This change adds the extra
step to the diagram to help clarify the process.

Change-Id: I5c256388c2247eba4e559eb94cc9fb1bcd42444a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-18 20:47:45.000000000', 'message': "Add test case for expanding implied roles in system tokens

This change is being backported because it provides a helper method in
the unit tests that another change relies on.

If a user has a role assignment on the system, which implies another
role assignment, the system-scoped token response should include
both role assignments.

This patch exposes a bug in the system-scoped token implementation
where implied roles aren't expanded out before returning the
token response to the user.

Change-Id: I176bbbda9658a54f6873a4009938f140a5b1a33e
Related-Bug: 1788694
(cherry picked from commit 6d7cfdb4ba5b8ce81d656dd22316505af6d382b8)
"}]
commit_message:
Add test case for expanding implied roles in system tokens

This change is being backported because it provides a helper method in
the unit tests that another change relies on.

If a user has a role assignment on the system, which implies another
role assignment, the system-scoped token response should include
both role assignments.

This patch exposes a bug in the system-scoped token implementation
where implied roles aren't expanded out before returning the
token response to the user.

Change-Id: I176bbbda9658a54f6873a4009938f140a5b1a33e
Related-Bug: 1788694
(cherry picked from commit 6d7cfdb4ba5b8ce81d656dd22316505af6d382b8)

Trying to build docs locally gave the following error:

Warning, treated as error:
RSVG converter command 'rsvg-convert' cannot be run. Check the rsvg_converter_bin setting

When I install librsvg2-bin on my (ubuntu) system, the build succeeds.

This commit creates a bindep.txt with librsvg2-bin/-tools to resolve
this.

Change-Id: Ide80ef527c94e86ebb54aee6d319fd41931e205b
"}]
commit_message:
Add librsvg2-bin/-tools to bindep.txt

Trying to build docs locally gave the following error:

Warning, treated as error:
RSVG converter command 'rsvg-convert' cannot be run. Check the rsvg_converter_bin setting

When I install librsvg2-bin on my (ubuntu) system, the build succeeds.

This commit creates a bindep.txt with librsvg2-bin/-tools to resolve
this.

Change-Id: Ide80ef527c94e86ebb54aee6d319fd41931e205b

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-09 00:07:42.000000000', 'message': "Stop raising 404 when no mountpoint for volume attachment

Show volume attachment raise 404 if there is no mountpoint for
that attachment which is different than List API behavior which do not
include 'device' in that case.

Both Get API should behave consistently.

Stop raising the 404 in Show API to make it same as List API.

Change-Id: Id2952e6c9af0aba3122a9e45a4eb8c5c42417fc9
Closes-Bug: #1554440
"}, {'created': '2017-04-13 20:05:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix 404 for no bdm.device_name when showing volume attachment details

Microversion 2.20 allows attaching a volume to a shelved-offloaed
instance. Since a shelved-offloaded instance does not have a host
associated it, a block device name is not reserved on the compute host
for the instance, since there is no compute host for the instance,
so BlockDeviceMapping.device_name is just set to None.

When showing details on this attached volume for a shelved offloaded
server, we get a 404 since it has some obscure legacy check for the
mountpoint to be set, assumingly to fill the response. Note, however,
that listing attachments does not care if there is a mountpoint. When
listing attachments, if there is no mountpoint the 'device' key is just
not part of the response.

To fix the 404, if there is no mountpoint and the instance is shelved
offloaded, we just return device=None.

This should not require a microversion bump since this code was
enforcing this mountpoint restriction long before the 2.20 use case
existed, and the 2.20 change arguably regressed this API. A user should
not have to attach a volume to a shelved offloaded server at 2.20 and then
have to use 2.43 to show details about that volume attachment. We do,
however, maintain backward compatibility with the response body such that
the 'device' key is still part of the response, even though the value is
None.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id2952e6c9af0aba3122a9e45a4eb8c5c42417fc9
Closes-Bug: #1554440
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 404 for no bdm.device_name when showing volume attachment details

Microversion 2.20 allows attaching a volume to a shelved-offloaed
instance. Since a shelved-offloaded instance does not have a host
associated it, a block device name is not reserved on the compute host
for the instance, since there is no compute host for the instance,
so BlockDeviceMapping.device_name is just set to None.

When showing details on this attached volume for a shelved offloaded
server, we get a 404 since it has some obscure legacy check for the
mountpoint to be set, assumingly to fill the response. Note, however,
that listing attachments does not care if there is a mountpoint. When
listing attachments, if there is no mountpoint the 'device' key is just
not part of the response.

To fix the 404, if there is no mountpoint and the instance is shelved
offloaded, we just return device=None.

This should not require a microversion bump since this code was
enforcing this mountpoint restriction long before the 2.20 use case
existed, and the 2.20 change arguably regressed this API. A user should
not have to attach a volume to a shelved offloaded server at 2.20 and then
have to use 2.43 to show details about that volume attachment. We do,
however, maintain backward compatibility with the response body such that
the 'device' key is still part of the response, even though the value is
None.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Id2952e6c9af0aba3122a9e45a4eb8c5c42417fc9
Closes-Bug: #1554440

Hi Sean,

By tests do you mean to test this by writing code (under nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py) using fake data to imitate this bug? (Sorry if this is a stupid qts.. just starting to understand OS)

Note: This bug was solved with respect to a third party vendor plugin where an interface to a vm running in one network to another network. This is a valid case in upstream neutron.
However, in the vendor plugin using neutron, case where the other network belongs to another enterprise, this operation of attaching the interface is not allowed. (The concept of separate enterprises is not in neutron.. only in the vendor plugin.)
I'm not sure how to reproduce this error using base upstream neutron w/o and vendor plugins such that it will raise an exception is nova which will not be forwarded to neutron."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-03 11:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
Better handling of Neutron BadRequest/ Vendor specific exceptions

When a vendor specific exception is raised, relay back the error
message from the exception to the cli.

Change-Id: I55453dd2b495c92e1f2c4c5c92a599278e29c7a0
Closes-Bug: #1481977

commit_message:
Add Oslo feature freeze to release schedule

Oslo freezes one week before non-client library freeze. We need to
note that in the release schedule.

Change-Id: I83713017b29ae900ccc9f3263e483984c3abc440

commit_message:
Fix filtering on dataframe endpoints

This fixes filtering on "GET /v1/dataframes" and "GET /v2/dataframes" by
ensuring that non-admin users will only have access to their data.

Change-Id: Id3da0cc4dae50edb77ec1ef3b446616617d2a49e
Story: 2006749
Task: 37232

subject: s3api: Delete multipart uploads via multi-delete
messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-10-22 15:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-10-22 15:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nBackport lost some changes to test_object_multi_DELETE_with_error, but that test was introduced https://review.opendev.org/#/c/618301/ which seems out-of-scope for stable. Func test should be sufficient to guard against regression, though.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 15:14:40.000000000', 'message': "s3api: Delete multipart uploads via multi-delete

We have code that's *supposed* to do it, but we weren't reading the
result of the bulk-delete, so we never actually deleted anything!

Change-Id: I5c972749cadf903161456f34371a6f83ebc05eb9
Closes-Bug: 1810567
(cherry picked from commit b35fc41184edf8b6d88ccbf5a4e34a7924e9c46a)
"}]
commit_message:
s3api: Delete multipart uploads via multi-delete

We have code that's *supposed* to do it, but we weren't reading the
result of the bulk-delete, so we never actually deleted anything!

Change-Id: I5c972749cadf903161456f34371a6f83ebc05eb9
Closes-Bug: 1810567
(cherry picked from commit b35fc41184edf8b6d88ccbf5a4e34a7924e9c46a)

commit_message:
Add tempest tests for node Adoption

This change adds a test scenario as well as basic API validation
test for tempest regarding the node adoption feature.

Closes-Bug: #1526315
Change-Id: Ic534f3e9c39f344d17ec542686be4eec428593a3

commit_message:
Add healthcheck middleware to pipeline

This introduces the oslo healt check middleware
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/healthcheck_plugins.html
into the pipelines. This middleware, which is useful for load balancers and
monitoring, can be used to validate that the nova-api service is operational.
This middleware is being used in other services such as glance and magnum. This
patch provides it for nova, in an effort to spread the usage across all major
projects.

This is one less item that operators will have to patch locally.

Change-Id: Ic6d67aa26889a945d43b03a7fa6af078d2b58f39
Closes-Bug: #1637483

commit_message:
Pass the parameter of extra image properties to create_snapshot_force().

I created an instance from volume, then created a instance snapshot by
volume backend. I discovered that the extra image properties is not
passed to volume_api.create_snapshot_force(), and this volume's snapshot
metadata is missing in cinder database.

This patch will add the parameter of extra image properties to the
volume_api.create_snapshot_force function.

Closes-bug: #1645770
Change-Id: Id979043b1573bf2ea473e772c7ea7417c733d754

commit_message:
Don't destroy evacuated instance if host didn't change

The current implementation of the method '_destroy_evacuated_instances'
in compute.manager deletes any instances from source after they have
been evacuated.

There is a possibility that if a VM fails as part of rebuild operation
on destination host after creating a migration record, then when the source
host is brought back up it may end up deleting the VM from source as well.

To fix this we should check the 'host' attribute in instances table before
deleting the VM and delete VM from source only if the host has been updated
in db after rebuild

Change-Id: If6a244401c5ac4fe25c7dccbcb61acf68fbe9175
Closes-Bug: #1636825

[{'created': '2016-10-21 10:06:50.000000000', 'message': "Set interface mtu value for configDrive

Image was installed cloudinit(version < 0.7.7), when boot instance from
the image and config network by configDrive, it will not set mtu item
for interface. However when network's type is tunnel, it cause that
frame's size will excess 1500. The commit will render interface's
template with mtu item, cloudinit will set interface mtu by
network_config file.

Change-Id: I96e98f5d4952a94f721bef39a7c58d5b637e1a29
"}]
commit_message:
Set interface mtu value for configDrive

Image was installed cloudinit(version < 0.7.7), when boot instance from
the image and config network by configDrive, it will not set mtu item
for interface. However when network's type is tunnel, it cause that
frame's size will excess 1500. The commit will render interface's
template with mtu item, cloudinit will set interface mtu by
network_config file.

Change-Id: I96e98f5d4952a94f721bef39a7c58d5b637e1a29

Release ovsdbapp 0.18.0

This contains some changes to support the OVS/OVN split which
can break the running of functional tests against OVS/OVN master.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-18 08:35:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix aggregate filter with empty or no extra specs

Currently,when boot vm with flavor's empty extra_specs,
it can be filtered to aggregate host with metadata.
this will lead aggregate host resource take up.
so change code to check aggregate host if has metadata.

Change-Id: Icfe3c7fb57d3e6f271de216caba75e1a76497dd5
close-bug: 1634032
"}]
commit_message:
Fix aggregate filter with empty or no extra specs

Currently,when boot vm with flavor's empty extra_specs,
it can be filtered to aggregate host with metadata.
this will lead aggregate host resource take up.
so change code to check aggregate host if has metadata.

Change-Id: Icfe3c7fb57d3e6f271de216caba75e1a76497dd5
close-bug: 1634032

commit_message:
Fix filtering on dataframe endpoints

This fixes filtering on "GET /v1/dataframes" and "GET /v2/dataframes" by
ensuring that non-admin users will only have access to their data.

Change-Id: Id3da0cc4dae50edb77ec1ef3b446616617d2a49e
Story: 2006749
Task: 37232

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
proposed fix for bug 1646896 - System hangs when using NFS storage backend with loopback mounts, Closes-Bug: #1646896

 method _is_mounted with mountpoint command
 Checks if bind mount is already mounted

Change-Id: Ib63851a55d7e94556c6d07466c52867c5242720f

commit_message:
VMware: use WithRetrieval in vm_util module

This change uses WithRetrieval[1] in nova.virt.vmwareapi.vm_util to
delegate VMware pagination to WithRetrieval which allows to remove
_get_object_from_results (used for pagination) and to inline
_get_object_for_optionvalue and _get_object_for_value.

[1] oslo.vmware.vim_util

Change-Id: I380db304a55bdc73a8467788c4773176dfb0838c

'}, {'created': '2016-08-19 09:51:10.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use admin context to create neutron ports

It turns out many operators expect Nova to create ports using the admin
context, and have disabled the ability for regular users to create
ports. While we no longer need to use the admin context to create ports
(because we do the port binding via an update_port call), there is also
no good reason to break the users that expect us to use the admin
context to create ports.

Longer term, we should be making our request using a token that
represents both the user context and the Nova service user, so we can
avoid using such a powerful admin context for all these operations.

In addition, we were sending admin_state_up=True when creating the port.
As this is the default setting, there is no need to send that value when
creating the port. Removing this removes any confusion around the fact
there is no need to use an admin context when creating a port.

Closes-Bug: #1608601
Change-Id: I3ccfe6e56ac22703350873a0a5c3d12c1a0d9eea

commit_message:
Use admin context to create neutron ports

It turns out many operators expect Nova to create ports using the admin
context, and have disabled the ability for regular users to create
ports. While we no longer need to use the admin context to create ports
(because we do the port binding via an update_port call), there is also
no good reason to break the users that expect us to use the admin
context to create ports.

Longer term, we should be making our request using a token that
represents both the user context and the Nova service user, so we can
avoid using such a powerful admin context for all these operations.
Once that is turned on by default, and the default policy is updated in
neutron, we should be good to get rid of this.

Co-Authored-By: Augustina Ragwitz <auggy@cpan.org>
Closes-Bug: #1608601

Change-Id: I3ccfe6e56ac22703350873a0a5c3d12c1a0d9eea

subject: Unquote URL before using splited parts.
messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-10-21 22:11:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-10-22 15:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nClean backport, test pops without changes under swift/, closes a user-facing bug.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-21 22:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Unquote URL before using splited parts.

Keystone EC2 access keys may contain URL reserved/unsafe chars,
then the access key in PATH_INFO can't be replace by account name.

ie.
  /v1/abc%3D/c/o  --> /v1/AUTH_PROJECT_ID/c/o

Change-Id: I034b0902f620cbb274647e24566dff2031beeae5
Closes-Bug: 1776476
(cherry picked from commit 8c7ca01ea7ee0943d5b3078b941c15932f6eecff)
"}]
commit_message:
Unquote URL before using splited parts.

Keystone EC2 access keys may contain URL reserved/unsafe chars,
then the access key in PATH_INFO can't be replace by account name.

ie.
  /v1/abc%3D/c/o  --> /v1/AUTH_PROJECT_ID/c/o

Change-Id: I034b0902f620cbb274647e24566dff2031beeae5
Closes-Bug: 1776476
(cherry picked from commit 8c7ca01ea7ee0943d5b3078b941c15932f6eecff)

In the backport [0] it was removed the loop that iterated
over each role to great the upgrade_steps_tasks playbook
and included the generation as part of the previous
secion (pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook) loop.
This causes the upgrade to stop working as upgrade_steps_
tasks will be build for only one role (the last we iterated
over in the previous loop) and running the upgrade for any
other role will end up in all the upgrade_tasks being
skipped.

commit_message:
[Rocky Only] Fix upgrade_steps_tasks playbook generation.

In the backport [0] it was removed the loop that iterated
over each role to create the upgrade_steps_tasks playbook
and included the generation as part of the previous
secion (pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook) loop.
This causes the upgrade to stop working as upgrade_steps_
tasks will be build for only one role (the last we iterated
over in the previous loop) and running the upgrade for any
other role will end up in all the upgrade_tasks being
skipped.

[0] - I4ee0110a6c2b9466d81e37e5df27f5f81a6eceb5
Change-Id: Iff7308b544f73fa698b4e532ca64a3ace19905ef
Closes-Bug: #1848789

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-30 10:23:59.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: ensure correct datastore usage when booting from volume

Make use of the cinder datastor when booting from a volume. There was
no need to relocate the volume from the cinder datastore to the nova one.
This breaks the cinder flavor selection.

Change-Id: I8fc60f0aac95b234a4cbf0ad9a6903f83036e70c
Close-bug: #1490257
'}, {'created': '2015-09-03 12:45:05.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: ensure volume is accessible by instance

In general we need to make use of the cinder datastore when booting
from a volume. In the event that the instance is unable to acces the
volume as cinder may select a datastore that is not accesible by the
host (this is when storage policies are not used).

We need to ensure that the cinder volume type is honored. If and only
if the volume is not accesible then we should reolcate.

Co-Authored-By: chinmay <chinmaya-bharadwaj.a@hp.com>

Change-Id: I8fc60f0aac95b234a4cbf0ad9a6903f83036e70c
Closes-bug: #1490257
Closes-bug: #1469655
'}, {'created': '2015-09-03 13:39:55.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: ensure volume is accessible by instance

commit_message:
VMware: ensure volume is accessible by instance

In general we need to make use of the cinder datastore when booting
from a volume. In the event that the instance is unable to acces the
volume as cinder may select a datastore that is not accesible by the
host (this is when storage policies are not used).

We need to ensure that the cinder volume type is honored. If and only
if the volume is not accesible then we should reolcate.

Co-Authored-By: chinmay <chinmaya-bharadwaj.a@hp.com>

Change-Id: I8fc60f0aac95b234a4cbf0ad9a6903f83036e70c
Closes-bug: #1490257
Closes-bug: #1469655

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Empty machine_id file causes get_sysinfo_serial_auto to fail.

Currently Nova only checks /etc/machine-id existence and not whether
an actual id is present.

With this patch Nova treats absence of /etc/machine-id file same as
the file being empty. So if /etc/machine_id file is empty, in auto mode,
use hardware serial for the libvirt driver (changing the auto_serial
function to use hardware_serial() if os_serial() raises a NovaException).

Change-Id: I27837c3da0eee4207717d50d5c3e3dba42326a39
Closes-Bug: 1584236

In bagpipe_bgp.common.run_command module output and error
of command are of type "bytes" instead of "string".
That causes some issues when it's running on Python 3.

So this patch fixes it by converting those variables always to
the string type.

Change-Id: I39233176ab9a3fd221fdd3f1871d5b1fe0ca601d

'}, {'created': '2019-10-16 19:45:14.000000000', 'message': 'assorted fixes in networking_bagpipe.bagpipe_bgp module

This change bundles two fixes for CI-breaking
bugs and which hence need to be pushed together.

bug #1846601 / Fix TypeError when calling join on bytes sequence

In bagpipe_bgp.common.run_command module output and error
of command are of type "bytes" instead of "string".
That causes some issues when it's running on Python 3.

So this patch fixes it by converting those variables always to
the string type.

bug #1846767 / Force copy of dict items in "for" loop

In module bagpipe_bgp.common.dataplane_utils in
ObjectLifecycleManager.clear_objects() method there is for loop
which iterates over items from dict.
To avoid changes of dict during iterations this patch forces always
to create list which is copy of items from dict.

'}]
commit_message:
assorted fixes in networking_bagpipe.bagpipe_bgp module

This change bundles two fixes for CI-breaking
bugs and which hence need to be pushed together.

bug #1846601 / Fix TypeError when calling join on bytes sequence

In bagpipe_bgp.common.run_command module output and error
of command are of type "bytes" instead of "string".
That causes some issues when it's running on Python 3.

So this patch fixes it by converting those variables always to
the string type.

bug #1846767 / Force copy of dict items in "for" loop

In module bagpipe_bgp.common.dataplane_utils in
ObjectLifecycleManager.clear_objects() method there is for loop
which iterates over items from dict.
To avoid changes of dict during iterations this patch forces always
to create list which is copy of items from dict.

Closes-Bug: #1846601
(cherry picked from commit 996ea4530433039ef41a3dcd82c48bba905480ad)
Closes-Bug: #1846767
(cherry picked from commit dbdbb2a92c6b64d9c521fdc9247fcaa342c7f1f9)

Change-Id: I39233176ab9a3fd221fdd3f1871d5b1fe0ca601d

commit_message:
Don't populate resources for not-yet-migrated inst

Per the referenced bug, it is possible for update_available_resource to
race with a migration such that the migration record exists, but the
instance's migration context doesn't. In such cases we shouldn't try to
track the instance's assigned resources on this host (because there
aren't any yet).

Change-Id: I69f99adfa8c91b50086052ca1b15c55e86ed614d
Closes-Bug: #1849165

commit_message:
Update Horizon Helm test to use python3

This change updates the tests container image
to one which installs python3.

The selenium-test.py template file has been refactored
to match the structure of the selenium tests in
openstack-helm-infra/tools/gate/selenium

Change-Id: I568bea8d715ea28b8e750215d166ba1b04e4172d

commit_message:
Permit access to Ceph RGW for 'member' role

From the Rocky release, Keystone is bootstrapped by default [1]
with a 'member' role, while previously we used to create at
deployment time a role called 'Member'.

Role names are case insensitive in Keystone but Ceph RGW expects
a whitelist of role names to which access is permitted. This change
adds 'member' to the Ceph RGW whitelist, in addition to 'Member'.

1. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/basic-default-roles

Change-Id: Ib3c70c136fa4a03b58edc370343a01d657b5b101
Closes-Bug: 1847539
(cherry picked from commit 1357a131c83e0d4c699df5b9230c382a803eb5d7)
(cherry picked from commit 7ecd756b7c5eff4ef938fced335d75123749b1f3)

commit_message:
Ignore sqla-migrate inspect.getargspec deprecation warnings on py36

The 'message' argument is a regex so you need to escape brackets and the
likes. Strange that this worked on py27.

This was coincidentally fixed by Ib9f735216773224f91ac7f49fbe2eee119670872
in Train but this change is backportable while that one is not.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/fixtures.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Ib9f735216773224f91ac7f49fbe2eee119670872 in Stein, as
noted above.

Change-Id: Ia1f0fa6a46bdd0a87d40721937355b2cc887f1c9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1813147
(cherry picked from commit 79ee80d159e8be0d9f8215c2c5e210c545c551a7)

commit_message:
Use new shiny Devices class instead of old ugly Device

The pyudev library migrated teh Device class to Devices and
while all the old methods still work, it's marked for removal
in one of the next releases.
Updating to the new class will probably prevent some
headaches.

Change-Id: I4a4c7ce7b5139af9c8886a759979d5b3f5bf8b8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-11 08:34:27.000000000', 'message': 'Stop sending bad values from libosinfo to libvirt

When we try to use either virtio1.0-block or virtio1.0-net it is
correctly rejected by libvirt. We get these returned from libosinfo for
newer operating systems that support virtio1.0.

As we want to support libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request
"virtio", please see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146
Closes-Bug: #1835400
(cherry picked from commit 6be668e51992df53a4d871bea70bc738a9beacb8)
(cherry picked from commit a06922d546a26c9e6550a93cbe0718cf841b6b9f)
(cherry picked from commit 89d2a764d75aad6876551663e8350d301336eb59)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop sending bad values from libosinfo to libvirt

When we try to use either virtio1.0-block or virtio1.0-net it is
correctly rejected by libvirt. We get these returned from libosinfo for
newer operating systems that support virtio1.0.

As we want to support libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request
"virtio", please see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146
Closes-Bug: #1835400
(cherry picked from commit 6be668e51992df53a4d871bea70bc738a9beacb8)
(cherry picked from commit a06922d546a26c9e6550a93cbe0718cf841b6b9f)
(cherry picked from commit 89d2a764d75aad6876551663e8350d301336eb59)

commit_message:
Update openstack-exporter chart to use new image

This change updates the prometheus-openstack-exporter
chart to pull an updated image which runs on python 3.

Co-Authored By: Bharat Khare <bk552w@att.com>
Depends On: https://review.opendev.org/686252
Change-Id: I4db500ba395b1d8417491bcde82be95a039eeb4f

[{'created': '2018-07-31 16:17:34.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure next marker is set when using custom field query

The next marker was not being set when the uuid field was not
not requested. In the case of collections, this delays
sanitization of the port until the next marker has been set.

Story: 2003192
Task: 23346
Change-Id: Ied45f698c3431c5113bae46c1a4f1de1cdaa2d74
'}, {'created': '2018-07-31 16:27:01.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure next marker is set when using custom field query

The next marker was not being set when the uuid field was not
not requested. In the case of collections, this delays
sanitization of the port until the next marker has been set.

Story: 2003192
Task: 23346
Change-Id: Ied45f698c3431c5113bae46c1a4f1de1cdaa2d74
'}, {'created': '2018-09-10 14:47:11.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure pagination marker is always set

Previously the pagination marker was not being set for list
queries where `uuid` was not in the list of requested fields.
The affected endpoints were: port, portgroup, volume_target,
volume_connector, node and chassis.

The next marker contains the UUID of the last element that
was returned to the client. This information was being
removed from elements in the collection. This meant that we
could no longer return a UUID for this marker. An extra
parameter, `sanitize` was added to `convert_with_links`.
This allows us to delay stripping this field from the
elements until after the next marker has been set.

Story: 2003192
Task: 23346
Change-Id: Ied45f698c3431c5113bae46c1a4f1de1cdaa2d74
'}, {'created': '2018-09-11 19:32:50.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure pagination marker is always set

Previously the pagination marker was not being set for list
queries where `uuid` was not in the list of requested fields.
The affected endpoints were: port, portgroup, volume_target,
volume_connector, node and chassis.

The next marker contains the UUID of the last element that
was returned to the client. This information was being
removed from elements in the collection. This meant that we
could no longer return a UUID for this marker. An extra
parameter, `sanitize` was added to `convert_with_links`.
This allows us to delay stripping this field from the
elements until after the next marker has been set.

Story: 2003192
Task: 23346
Change-Id: Ied45f698c3431c5113bae46c1a4f1de1cdaa2d74
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure pagination marker is always set

Previously the pagination marker was not being set for list
queries where `uuid` was not in the list of requested fields.
The affected endpoints were: port, portgroup, volume_target,
volume_connector, node and chassis.

The next marker contains the UUID of the last element that
was returned to the client. This information was being
removed from elements in the collection. This meant that we
could no longer return a UUID for this marker. An extra
parameter, `sanitize` was added to `convert_with_links`.
This allows us to delay stripping this field from the
elements until after the next marker has been set.

Story: 2003192
Task: 23346
Change-Id: Ied45f698c3431c5113bae46c1a4f1de1cdaa2d74

commit_message:
Use client architecture and set bootfile-url for DHCPv6 in inspector

For DHCPv6 PXE boot, the Client Architecture option uses code 61,
see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5970#section-3.3. Use this
to determine if booting over EFI and set the DHCPv6 bootfile-url
when booting PXE over EFI.

Change-Id: I096ac412c015c3ac488d712010aafe52b572cfad
(cherry picked from commit 3af894300266428ba3daa243d579680f583c7e96)

commit_message:
Fix the stable/queens branch to work with Ceilometer Queens

The development on Ceilosca skipped from Pike to Queens.
This is an attempt to fill in that gap.

Much of the change to remove the Ceilometer API related
functionality has been backported from stable/rocky.
Includes a minor backport of Python 3 support.

Change-Id: I053fa632e0f5b2473fd080c07520f00c1eef8016
Story: 2006709
Task: 37069

commit_message:
fix session cert arguments

All calls to the deprecated ironic commands are failing because
unsupported cert arguments are being used to create the session
(cafile, certfile, keyfile)

This change switches to using the correct arguments. It is proposed
first on stable/stein because the deprecated ironic commands were
removed in Train.

Change-Id: If0730c0d9c1c3a700cbc6ae16b1c3752d0b681c4
Story: 2006748
Task: 37230

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 20:31:48.000000000', 'message': "WIP: sphinx latex build tests

* Svg2pdf to fix svg image inclusion
* The literalinclude of nova.conf is too large and exceeds tex's
  memory limit.  Produces this error:
    TeX capacity exceeded, sorry [main memory size=5000000].
  Potential solutions:
  * increase limit (this works, but it's a sudo task so will limit
    local build reproducibility)
  * break up includes?
  * do more research into other options
* The nesting of the API reference is too deep for standard latex.
  However, sphinx provides an override setting.  Here I've set it
  to 10.
  * Also look into using the enumitem package.

Change-Id: I3659e5eba1255f8bb80131c2f0edc3862d6cafad
"}, {'created': '2019-08-21 21:14:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix issues building PDF docs

This fixes errors that occur when building PDF versions of the
docs.

svg2pdf is added as a docs dependency because the SVG images
can not be included in PDFs natively.

The literalinclude of nova.conf is too large and exceeds TeX's
memory limit in most environments.  To avoid this, we omit
this from PDF builds, but retain it in HTML builds.  In the
future, folks may wish to explore breaking the config file into
smaller sections which would solve this problem and potentially
improve the readability in the HTML form.

The nesting of the API reference is too deep for standard LaTeX.
However, Sphinx provides an override setting.  Here it is set
to 10 which is more than necessary for the current level of
nesting.

Change-Id: I3659e5eba1255f8bb80131c2f0edc3862d6cafad
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues building PDF docs

This fixes errors that occur when building PDF versions of the
docs.

svg2pdf is added as a docs dependency because the SVG images
can not be included in PDFs natively.

The literalinclude of nova.conf is too large and exceeds TeX's
memory limit in most environments.  To avoid this, we omit
this from PDF builds, but retain it in HTML builds.  In the
future, folks may wish to explore breaking the config file into
smaller sections which would solve this problem and potentially
improve the readability in the HTML form.

The nesting of the API reference is too deep for standard LaTeX.
However, Sphinx provides an override setting.  Here it is set
to 10 which is more than necessary for the current level of
nesting.

Change-Id: I3659e5eba1255f8bb80131c2f0edc3862d6cafad

Fix Molecule tests

Molecule tests using our custom modules were failing due to the lack of
yaml lib. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I859e64f8c469eb8b02af09be7ce4753e41084251
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9991eb2d64961535494ab6b38f9bb8e8dbaad12d)

'}, {'created': '2019-10-21 20:08:55.000000000', 'message': "Func: bug 1849165: mig race with _populate_assigned_resources

Add a functional regression test for the referenced bug:

If a migration is initiated, and update_available_resource runs on the
destination between when the migration record is associated with the
destination and when the migration context is added to the instance, it
will raise a TypeError attempting to _populate_assigned_resources for
that instance, because that method attempts to access the
(as-yet-nonexistent) migration context.

Note that this doesn't fail the migration; it just leaves ugly logs. In
real life it probably also leaves other pieces of
update_available_resource unfinished on the destination.

Related-Bug: #1849165
Change-Id: I7e96cd24049c205f76a684a2e7425f85b4376f73

commit_message:
Func: bug 1849165: mig race with _populate_assigned_resources

Add a functional regression test for the referenced bug:

If a migration is initiated, and update_available_resource runs on the
destination between when the migration record is associated with the
destination and when the migration context is added to the instance, it
will raise a TypeError attempting to _populate_assigned_resources for
that instance, because that method attempts to access the
(as-yet-nonexistent) migration context.

Note that this doesn't fail the migration; it just leaves ugly logs. In
real life it probably also leaves other pieces of
update_available_resource unfinished on the destination.

Related-Bug: #1849165
Change-Id: I7e96cd24049c205f76a684a2e7425f85b4376f73

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/ctlplane-ip-range.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the
validation framework.

This patch synchronizes the ctlplane-ip-range validation.

Change-Id: I5343e75d3d4edc75c3a590ce72c77786c1a32f9d

commit_message:
python-novaclient: release ussuri 16.0.0

This is just the minor version bump release that is being done
mainly:

Commit-Id: 8744bea0e3ebe5bc4d0d899189bfa0bcdcb0a08f
  - Add user_id/project_id to migration-list API

Commit-Id: 71c29a184b388b38d81dc609b9883c5e8f7166cf
  - Add aggregate-cache-images command and client routines

Commit-Id: e1bb4378db1e5be85a59861c2d473388fa336da8
  - Add images.GlanceManager.find_images() bulk query

Commit-Id: 380fc0851387bd4c875afaebc0858646d061beb5
  - Add functional test for migration-list

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675023
Change-Id: I5d2a039ba3f60d81a67b35592a2e4cbf2be555ca

commit_message:
Keystone Authtoken Cache: allow universal secret key to be set

This PS allows a cache secret key for all instances of keystone
middleware to be defined in a single location.

Change-Id: I3d5c78732d8a8bb9110117130f0d886fea609526
Partial-Bug: 1753251

commit_message:
Remove TODO from get_provider_tree_and_ensure_root

The ResourceTracker knows when it created a new compute
node record and thus would need to create its corresponding
resource provider in placement. So one would think that the
RT could just avoid doing that "ensure resource provider" check
on each periodic for an existing compute node record, but
because of nested resource providers, we need to continue to
always call _ensure_resource_provider which also fetches
any nested providers via GET /resource_providers?in_tree=<uuid>,
and nested providers can be added/removed from the tree out
of band by other projects like neutron and cyborg. So since
we can't avoid the in_tree call on each periodic, we might as
well just remove the TODO associated with it.

Change-Id: I6cceacb79b99f2946bacf4043a6077fbd855a30e
